instance.context:
According to Edward Gibbon
, in Chapter XXXI of his work The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire , the Roman people , at the start of the 5th century : ... still considered the Circus as their home , their temple , and the seat of the republic .

Most
harriers are placed in the genus Circus , derived from the Ancient Greek kirkos , referring to a bird of prey named for its circling flight ( kirkos , " circle " ) , probably the hen harrier . Genus Circus

the children always love to go to the
circus ;

it was so funny it was a
circus ;

they used the elephants to help put up the
circus ;

he ran away from home to join the
circus ;
